annotation.spannedText: These troubling statistics show that the failure to vaccinate children endangers both the health of children themselves as well as others who would not be exposed to preventable illness if the community as a whole were better protected

classMention.mentionClass: These troubling statistics show that the failure to vaccinate children endangers both the health of children themselves as well as others who would not be exposed to preventable illness if the community as a whole were better protected

annotation.spannedText: Equally troubling, the number of deliberately unvaccinated children has grown large enough that it may be fueling more severe outbreaks

classMention.mentionClass: Equally troubling, the number of deliberately unvaccinated children has grown large enough that it may be fueling more severe outbreaks

annotation.spannedText: vaccines can cause autism in healthy children

classMention.mentionClass: vaccines can cause autism in healthy children

annotation.spannedText: more than 1,500 parents

classMention.mentionClass: more than 1,500 parents

annotation.spannedText: This sad state of affairs exists because parents have been persistently and insidiously misled by information in the press and on the Internet and because the health care system has not effectively communicated the counterarguments, which are powerful

classMention.mentionClass: This sad state of affairs exists because parents have been persistently and insidiously misled by information in the press and on the Internet and because the health care system has not effectively communicated the counterarguments, which are powerful

annotation.spannedText: Physicians and other health experts can no longer just assume that parents will readily agree to childhood inoculations and leave any discussion about the potential risks and benefits to the last minute

classMention.mentionClass: Physicians and other health experts can no longer just assume that parents will readily agree to childhood inoculations and leave any discussion about the potential risks and benefits to the last minute

annotation.spannedText: They need to be more proactive, provide better information and engage parents much earlier than is usually the case

classMention.mentionClass: They need to be more proactive, provide better information and engage parents much earlier than is usually the case

annotation.spannedText: A proper conversation that respects the reluctant parents’ concerns, answers their questions and reassures them that the inoculations are indeed necessary—that countless studies by hundreds of researchers over many decades have shown that vaccinations save millions of lives—will likely take at least another 20 minutes

classMention.mentionClass: A proper conversation that respects the reluctant parents’ concerns, answers their questions and reassures them that the inoculations are indeed necessary—that countless studies by hundreds of researchers over many decades have shown that vaccinations save millions of lives—will likely take at least another 20 minutes

annotation.spannedText: This all too common scene should never happen

classMention.mentionClass: This all too common scene should never happen

annotation.spannedText: Having this discussion at the two-month well-baby visit is too late

classMention.mentionClass: Having this discussion at the two-month well-baby visit is too late

annotation.spannedText: Each of these concerns can be met with a careful review of the evidence

classMention.mentionClass: Each of these concerns can be met with a careful review of the evidence

annotation.spannedText: These results also show the flaws in the “free rider” argument, which erroneously suggests that an unvaccinated child can avoid any real or perceived risks of inoculation because enough other children will have been vaccinated to protect the untreated child

classMention.mentionClass: These results also show the flaws in the “free rider” argument, which erroneously suggests that an unvaccinated child can avoid any real or perceived risks of inoculation because enough other children will have been vaccinated to protect the untreated child

annotation.spannedText: Depending on fate to soften the blow from an infection is also more dangerous than most people realize

classMention.mentionClass: Depending on fate to soften the blow from an infection is also more dangerous than most people realize

annotation.spannedText: Even when parents appreciate the peril of not vaccinating, they want to know that vaccines are safe

classMention.mentionClass: Even when parents appreciate the peril of not vaccinating, they want to know that vaccines are safe

annotation.spannedText: Because vaccines are given to huge numbers of people, including healthy infants, they are held to a much higher safety standard than medications used for people who are already sick

classMention.mentionClass: Because vaccines are given to huge numbers of people, including healthy infants, they are held to a much higher safety standard than medications used for people who are already sick

annotation.spannedText: Nothing in medicine is 100 percent safe, however, and the absolute safety of vaccines cannot be proved

classMention.mentionClass: Nothing in medicine is 100 percent safe, however, and the absolute safety of vaccines cannot be proved

annotation.spannedText: Safety can be inferred, though, by the relative absence of serious side effects in multiple studies

classMention.mentionClass: Safety can be inferred, though, by the relative absence of serious side effects in multiple studies

annotation.spannedText: the measles vaccine could cause autism in susceptible children

classMention.mentionClass: the measles vaccine could cause autism in susceptible children

annotation.spannedText: Andrew J. Wakefield and 12 colleagues

classMention.mentionClass: Andrew J. Wakefield and 12 colleagues

annotation.spannedText: vaccines do not cause autism

classMention.mentionClass: vaccines do not cause autism

annotation.spannedText: more than a dozen studies

classMention.mentionClass: more than a dozen studies

annotation.spannedText: it is rare in science that published scientific findings have been so thoroughly, and publicly, disproved

classMention.mentionClass: it is rare in science that published scientific findings have been so thoroughly, and publicly, disproved

annotation.spannedText: Investigating narrow, specific theories about vaccines does not seem to provide adequate reassurance to parents with broad and vague worries about vaccines

classMention.mentionClass: Investigating narrow, specific theories about vaccines does not seem to provide adequate reassurance to parents with broad and vague worries about vaccines

annotation.spannedText: A good place for talks to begin would be in a prenatal class devoted to vaccines or through Web chats with physicians and vaccine researchers

classMention.mentionClass: A good place for talks to begin would be in a prenatal class devoted to vaccines or through Web chats with physicians and vaccine researchers

annotation.spannedText: Web interactions, in particular, might encourage prospective parents to openly air their concerns and raise sensitive questions they may not feel comfortable asking in a face-to-face visit with their child’s own pediatrician

classMention.mentionClass: Web interactions, in particular, might encourage prospective parents to openly air their concerns and raise sensitive questions they may not feel comfortable asking in a face-to-face visit with their child’s own pediatrician

annotation.spannedText: Education campaigns should also be carried out

classMention.mentionClass: Education campaigns should also be carried out

annotation.spannedText: many moms and dads will still need a forum where they can find accurate information, voice their worries, and engage in a full discussion about the benefits and risk of vaccines

classMention.mentionClass: many moms and dads will still need a forum where they can find accurate information, voice their worries, and engage in a full discussion about the benefits and risk of vaccines

annotation.spannedText: many will still want their infant’s doctor to look them in the eyes and say, “This is one of the best things you can do for your child’s health

annotation.spannedText: vaccines prevent potentially fatal diseases

classMention.mentionClass: vaccines prevent potentially fatal diseases

annotation.spannedText: vaccines have a high degree of safety

annotation.spannedText: their safety is constantly evaluated and reevaluated in a system operating independently from the pharmaceutical companies that make vaccines

annotation.spannedText: Unless this message gets spread widely and well, too many doctors and parents are going to find themselves in emergency rooms and isolation wards, watching children suffer with the devastating effects of measles, whooping cough or some other readily preventable infectious disease
